metadata.Title: CVE-2021-27292 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ua-parser-js >= 0.7.14, fixed in 0.7.24, uses a regular expression which is vulnerable to denial of service. If an attacker sends a malicious User-Agent header, ua-parser-js will get stuck processing it for an extended period of time.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-27292` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-ua-parser-js - 0.7.31+ds+~0.7.36-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: node-ua-parser-js package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.7.31+ds+~0.7.36-1').
